snippet: White House advisers say that addressing the nation’s racial conflicts is now an imperative for the president’s final years in office.
abstract: African-American activists express disappointment at Pres Obama's perceived reluctance to address nation's racial conflicts; Obama has not stood behind protesters or linked arms with civil rights leaders in days since grand juries in Missouri and Staten Island decided not to bring charges against white police officers linked to fatal encounters with unarmed black men; few of Obama's aides dispute that he is personally conflicted and constrained by position he holds.

byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: White House advisers say that addressing the nation’s racial conflicts is now an imperative for the president’s final years in office.

headline.main: Unrest Over Race Is Testing Obama’s Legacy
headline.print_headline: Unrest Over Race Is Testing Obama’s Legacy
